Community

Welcome Here

We are a proud member of ACON’s Welcome Here Project, previously known as the Safe Place Project.
Published 16 May
As a member we: 

1. Welcome and include Lesbian, Gay, Bi, Trans, Intersex, Queer, Questioning and other gender or sexuality diverse people (LGBTIQ+). We want everyone to feel welcomed and accepted every time they visit our centre.
2. Create positive change in our local community. We all have the power and responsibility to encourage positive social change.  
3. Actively celebrate LGBTIQ+ diversity. We embrace and value diversity and are committed to celebrating diverse communities. 

The Welcome Here Project supports local business owners and services in Australia to create and promote environments that are visibly welcoming and inclusive of LGBTIQ+ people. 

As a member of the ACON's Welcome Here, throughout our centre we have displayed rainbow stickers in windows, and the Welcome Here charter to let everyone know that LGBTIQ+ diversity is welcomed and celebrated. 

You’ll find these stickers at our entrances, and the charter at our information desk or in our centre management office, so join us in creating positive social change and celebrating our LGBTIQ+ neighbours.

Welcome Here

We acknowledge and respect the traditional lands and cultures of the Yuggera people, the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the Country on which The Village Upper Mount Gravatt resides, and pay our respects to Elders past and present. We recognise First Nations peoples' longstanding and ongoing spiritual connections to land, sea, community, and country.
